00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 problemPreserveAnswers.pl - Allow sticky answers to preserve special characters.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This file implements a fragile hack to overcome a problem with
00024 PGbasicmacros.pl, which removes special characters from student
00025 answers (in order to prevent EV3 from mishandling them).
00026 
00027 Unfortunately, this means that "sticky" answers will lose
00028 those characters, which makes it very difficult to answer
00029 problems with more than one answer when the student wants
00030 to submit several times while working on later parts.
00031 
00032 The real fix to to rewrite PGbasicmacros.pl to handle
00033 this better, but this hack will handle the situation for
00034 now until that can be accomplished.
00035 
00036 To use this hack, simply load the file using
00037 
00038     loadMacros("problemPreserveAnswers.pl");
00039 
00040 at the top of your PG file.
00041 
00042 =cut
00043 
00044 sub _problemPreserveAnswers_init {PreserveAnswers::Init()}
00045 
00046 package PreserveAnswers;
00047 
00048 #
00049 #  Escape the specials in answers, and then
00050 #  override ENDDOCUMENT() to restore the answers
00051 #  to their original values.
00052 #
00053 sub Init {
00054   PreserveAnswers::EscapeAnswers();
00055   $PreserveAnswers::ENDDOCUMENT = \&main::ENDDOCUMENT;
00056   main::PG_restricted_eval
00057     ('sub ENDDOCUMENT {PreserveAnswers::RestoreAnswers(); &$PreserveAnswers::ENDDOCUMENT(@_)}');
00058 }
00059 
00060 #
00061 #  This is a fragile hack to prevent PG from removing the
00062 #  dollar signs in currency answers (and everything else as well).
00063 #  PGbasicmacros.pl needs to be fixed to allow this without
00064 #  having to do this terrible hack.
00065 #
00066 sub EscapeAnswers {
00067   my $original = $main::inputs_ref_orig = {%{$main::inputs_ref}};
00068   my $inputs   = $main::inputs_ref;
00069   foreach my $id (keys %{$original}) {
00070     my $value = $original->{$id};
00071     next if !defined($value) || ref($value);
00072     $value =~ s/([\\\$@\`"&<>])/EscapeHTMLchar($1)/ge;
00073     $inputs->{$id} = $value;
00074   }
00075 }
00076 
00077 sub EscapeHTMLchar {main::spf(ord(shift),"&#x%02X;")}
00078 
00079 sub RestoreAnswers {
00080   my $original = $main::inputs_ref_orig;
00081   my $inputs   = $main::inputs_ref;
00082   foreach my $id (keys %{$original}) {$inputs->{$id} = $original->{$id}}
00083 }
00084 
00085 our $ENDDOCUMENT; # holds pointer to original ENDDOCUMENT
00086 
00087 ######################################################################
00088 
00089 1;
